file_content.text: Always a pleasure to see you, my lord.
Good to see you again, sir.
Things are quiet now--let's keep it that way.
Hello again. Excuse me, but I'm somewhat busy at the moment.
Glad to see you all survived. The landing beacons appear to be functioning normally again, thanks to you.
Welcome back, my lord. Sensors indicate you rerouted power to all the landing beacons.
You did it, sir. According to sensors, all energy fluctuations from the landing beacons have ceased.
Seems you did your job. We're not reading anymore energy fluctuations from the landing beacons.
Analysis indicates they were deliberately sabotaged to drive the jungle beasts insane. I'm transmitting a full report to Kaas City.
You've done the Empire a great service and earned this special recognition. Good day to you all.
Please accept this and my deepest gratitude, my lord. I bid you good day.
I trust you'll find this payment satisfactory, sir. I apologize if I delayed you. Good day.
You earned your wages for this work, but don't think it entitles you to special treatment. Goodbye.
Your efforts here are greatly appreciated. Take this reward and my thanks.
I still read energy fluctuations in the jungle, my lord. Some of the landing beacons haven't had their power rerouted.
Sir, reports indicate some of the landing beacons have not yet had their power rerouted.
Sensors indicate the energy fluctuations continue. We need those landing beacons dealt with.
Welcome, all of you. I'm Commander Rilan. I have an emergency situation here--your timing couldn't be better.
I'm Commander Rilan, my lord. I apologize for my abruptness, but I'm afraid I must request assistance with an emergency.
Welcome, sir. I'm Commander Rilan. We have an emergency on our hands and could use an extra officer on point.
You, there. I'm Commander Rilan. I'm authorized to recruit armed individuals to deal with an emerging threat in this area.
I'm Commander Rilan. I have an emergency situation that requires immediate assistance.
Something is stirring up the jungle beasts, which makes the route between here and Kaas City hazardous.
Several individuals traveling on foot have disappeared. I've even had reports of jungle beasts attacking speeders.
I fail to see how this is my problem, Commander.
Deal with it.
My lord, the situation is more complex than a few hungry predators. Permit me to explain.
Dromund Kaas is going to be more exciting than I thought.
How delightful.
Ah, yes, my lord. As you say. However, this situation cannot be allowed to continue.
Send a strike team to put down these predators.
Exterminate the beasts.
I've already tried that, sir. The results were... unexpected.
Bet you Imperials taste pretty good with some gacho sauce.
Maybe the beasts are hungry?
You alien scum think you're hilarious, don't you?
Watch that tone with me, or I'll revoke your authorization to visit this world.
I'm trained to handle this.
Given the circumstances, I believe someone of your abilities is precisely what's needed.
This seems trivial.
One of the speeders that was attacked belonged to an admiral. She escaped serious injury, but the situation demands immediate action.
I dispatched two commando teams into the jungle to clear out the beasts, but they never returned.
An emergency holomessage came through from one of the team leaders. I'll play it for you....
...Repeat, landing beacons are emitting some kind of energy! Power surges are driving the beasts mad!
Can't get close enough to reroute power... lost my team... beasts closing in... need reinforce--yaaaah!
Sensors confirm unusual energy readings in the jungle. The spaceport's landing beacons appear to be the cause.
How could landing beacons affect the creatures?
Landing beacons?
If a beacon's energy signature has been altered, the sonic frequency could be extremely disruptive to a creature's nervous system.
Let's deal with this.
Thank you. A team as skilled as yours is exactly what's needed.
I'm deeply grateful for your assistance, my lord.
Thank you, sir. I'm glad you're here to help.
Excellent. Your willingness to serve will be noted in my report.
The spaceport's landing beacons are scattered throughout the nearby jungle. You'll need to reroute power on all of them.
There's no mystery here, Commander. Destroy the landing beacons.
Get rid of them.
I can't do that. Without proper guidance, approaching starships can easily stray off course and crash into the jungle.
I understand you're all very busy, but I need people of your skills to reroute power on those landing beacons--and quickly.
I hesitate to ask, my lord, but if you reroute power on those landing beacons, the Empire will be most grateful.
I realize I'm asking a great deal of you, sir, but someone needs to reroute power on those landing beacons.
You look like someone at home in a jungle, and you're well armed. I need you to reroute power on those landing beacons.
I require someone of your particular skills to reroute the power on those landing beacons immediately.
I'll track your progress from here. Return when you're done. Good luck--the jungle predators are fierce.
It's an honor to receive you, my lord. Welcome to Dromund Kaas. I am at your service.
Welcome to Dromund Kaas, sir. If there is anything I can do for you, do not hesitate to ask.
Move along, or I'll have you arrested for loitering.
Pardon me, but I'm quite busy at the moment.
